tool_description: Context.IO is a modern, scalable email API that brings IMAP into the 21st century.
name: ContextIO
title: ContextIO

api_list.name: connectTokensWizard
api_list.description: Connect tokens are a feature we provide to facilitate account creation.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: callbackUrl
required_parameters.description: When the user’s mailbox is connected to your API key, the browser will call this url (GET). This call will have a parameter called contextio_token indicating the connect_token related to this callback. You can then do a get on this connect_token to obtain details about the account and source created through that token and save that account id in your own user data.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

optional_parameters.name: sourceSyncFolders
optional_parameters.description: By default, we filter out some folders like 'Deleted Items’ and 'Drafts’. Set this parameter to `All`,`Trash` to show the 'Deleted Items’ folder.

optional_parameters.name: lastName
optional_parameters.description: Last name of the account holder.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email address of the account to be added. If specified, the first step of the connect UI where users are prompted for their email address, first name and last name is skipped.

optional_parameters.name: statusCallbackUrl
optional_parameters.description: If specified, we’ll make a POST request to this URL if the connection status of the source changes.

optional_parameters.name: sourceExpungeOnDeletedFlag
optional_parameters.description: By default, we don’t filter out messages flagged as deleted. Set this parameter to `on` to turn on this filtering.

optional_parameters.name: firstName
optional_parameters.description: First name of the account holder.

optional_parameters.name: sourceSyncAllFolders
optional_parameters.description: By default, we filter out some folders like ‘Deleted Items’ and 'Drafts’. Set this parameter to `off` to turn off this filtering and show every single folder.

optional_parameters.name: sourceCallbackUrl
optional_parameters.description: If specified, we’ll make a POST request to this URL when the initial sync is completed.

optional_parameters.name: sourceRawFileList
optional_parameters.description: By default, we filter out files like signature images or those winmail.dat files form the files list. Set this parameter to 1 to turn off this filtering and show every single file attachments.

api_list.name: createAccount
api_list.description: You can create an account with no source by only passing in the email param. If you choose this option, you will need to add a source later.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: email
required_parameters.description: The primary email address used to receive emails in this account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

optional_parameters.name: firstName
optional_parameters.description: First name of the account holder.

optional_parameters.name: syncAllFolders
optional_parameters.description: By default, we filter out some folders like ‘Deleted Items’ and 'Drafts’. Set this parameter to `off` to turn off this filtering and show every single folder.

optional_parameters.name: callbackUrl
optional_parameters.description: If specified, we’ll make a POST request to this URL when the initial sync is completed.

optional_parameters.name: statusCallbackUrl
optional_parameters.description: If specified, we’ll make a POST request to this URL if the connection status of the source changes.

optional_parameters.name: lastName
optional_parameters.description: Last name of the account holder.

optional_parameters.name: expungeOnDeletedFlag
optional_parameters.description: By default, we don’t filter out messages flagged as deleted. Set this parameter to `on` to turn on this filtering.

api_list.name: createApplicationLevelWebhook
api_list.description: Webhooks set at the application level apply to all users in your userbase.Application level webhooks encourage a more DRY approach to using the Context.IO API.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: callbackUrl
required_parameters.description: A valid URL Context.IO calls when a matching message is found. The callback URL is called with an HTTP POST with message information in request body

required_parameters.name: failureNotifyUrl
required_parameters.description: (DEPRECATED) A valid URL Context.IO calls if the WebHooks fails and will no longer be active. That may happen if, for example, the server becomes unreachable or if it closes an IDLE connection and we can’t re-establish it.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

optional_parameters.name: active
optional_parameters.description: By default, webhooks are set to active when first created. Set to 'false' to temporarily stop receiving callbacks for this webhook. Set to `true` again to resume.

optional_parameters.name: filterFileName
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages where a file whose name matches the given string is attached.

optional_parameters.name: filterSubject
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages with a subject matching a given string or regular expression.

optional_parameters.name: filterFolderRemoved
optional_parameters.description: Check for messages removed from a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label removed from a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

optional_parameters.name: filterFolderAdded
optional_parameters.description: Check for messages filed in a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label applied to a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

optional_parameters.name: filterThread
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages in a given thread. Value can be a gmail_thread_id or the email_message_id of an existing message currently in the thread.

optional_parameters.name: bodyType
optional_parameters.description: Required to be set when “include_body” is set to get only body parts of a given MIME-type

optional_parameters.name: receiveHistorical
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true`, we will perform a backscan of an account when a new account is added and send messages from new to old to your callback URL.

optional_parameters.name: receiveAllChanges
optional_parameters.description: By default, we only send a webhook notification on the first event of a message (i.e. when a message is received or sent). Subsequent changes of a specific message do not trigger a webhook (i.e. if a message changes folders). When this parameter is set to `true`, we will send all events related to a message.

optional_parameters.name: filterFolderRemoved
optional_parameters.description: Check for messages removed from a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label removed from a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

optional_parameters.name: receiveDrafts
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true`, you will receive messages that are flagged as `Drafts` in Gmail

optional_parameters.name: includeBody
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` to include message bodies in the result. Since message bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: includeHeader
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` or raw to include message headers in the result.

optional_parameters.name: filterTo
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages received to a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

optional_parameters.name: filterFrom
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages received from a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

optional_parameters.name: filterEmailList
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages received from a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

optional_parameters.name: filterToDomains
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages sent to a given domain. Also accepts a comma delimited list of domains.

api_list.name: createOauthProvider
api_list.description: Add an oauth provider.

required_parameters.name: providerConsumerKey
required_parameters.description: The OAuth2 Client ID.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: type
required_parameters.description: Identification of the OAuth2 provider.

required_parameters.name: providerConsumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The OAuth2 Client Secret

api_list.name: createSources
api_list.description: Use this endpoint to add a source to an existing account. An account id is required to add a source to an existing account.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: server
required_parameters.description: Name of IP of the IMAP server, eg. imap.gmail.com.

required_parameters.name: providerRefreshToken
required_parameters.description: An OAuth2 refresh token obtained from the IMAP account provider to authenticate this email account. Required if using oauth when creating a source and account in a single call.

required_parameters.name: email
required_parameters.description: The primary email address used to receive emails in this account.

required_parameters.name: port
required_parameters.description: Port number to connect to on the server. For most servers, SSL is 993, and unencrypted (non-SSL) is 143.

required_parameters.name: providerConsumerKey
required_parameters.description: The OAuth2 Client ID used to obtain the the refresh token for the above account. Required if using oauth when creating a source and account in a single call.

required_parameters.name: type
required_parameters.description: Currently, the only supported type is IMAP.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: useSsl
required_parameters.description: Set to 1 if you want SSL encryption to be used when opening connections to the IMAP server. Any other value will be considered as “do not use SSL”.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.description: The username used to authenticate an IMAP connection. On some servers, this is the same thing as the primary email address.

optional_parameters.name: originIp
optional_parameters.description: IP address of the end user requesting the account to be created

optional_parameters.name: rawFileList
optional_parameters.description: By default, we filter out files like signature images or those winmail.dat files form the files list. Set this parameter to `off` to turn off this filtering and show every single file attachments.

optional_parameters.name: expungeOnDeletedFlag
optional_parameters.description: By default, we don’t filter out messages flagged as deleted. Set this parameter to `on` to turn on this filtering.

optional_parameters.name: callbackUrl
optional_parameters.description: If specified, we’ll make a POST request to this URL when the initial sync is completed.

optional_parameters.name: statusCallbackUrl
optional_parameters.description: If specified, we’ll make a POST request to this URL if the connection status of the source changes.

optional_parameters.name: password
optional_parameters.description: Password for this source. Required when creating a source and account in a single call. Ignored if any of the provider_* parameters are set below.

optional_parameters.name: syncAllFolders
optional_parameters.description: By default, we filter out some folders like ‘Deleted Items’ and 'Drafts’. Set this parameter to `off` to turn off this filtering and show every single folder.

api_list.name: createUserLevelWebhook
api_list.description: Webhooks set at the user level are applicable only to the user on which the webhook is set. User level webhooks should be used for cases when you will be monitoring things that are very specific to each individual user.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: failureNotifyUrl
required_parameters.description: (DEPRECATED) A valid URL Context.IO calls if the WebHooks fails and will no longer be active. That may happen if, for example, the server becomes unreachable or if it closes an IDLE connection and we can’t re-establish it.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: callbackUrl
required_parameters.description: A valid URL Context.IO calls when a matching message is found. The callback URL is called with an HTTP POST with message information in request body

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

optional_parameters.name: filterThread
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages in a given thread. Value can be a gmail_thread_id or the email_message_id of an existing message currently in the thread.

optional_parameters.name: filterFolderAdded
optional_parameters.description: Check for messages filed in a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label applied to a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

optional_parameters.name: filterFolderRemoved
optional_parameters.description: Check for messages removed from a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label removed from a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

optional_parameters.name: filterFileName
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages where a file whose name matches the given string is attached.

optional_parameters.name: filterSubject
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages with a subject matching a given string or regular expression.

optional_parameters.name: receiveDrafts
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true`, you will receive messages that are flagged as 'Drafts' in Gmail

optional_parameters.name: includeHeader
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` or raw to include message headers in the result.

optional_parameters.name: includeBody
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` to include message bodies in the result. Since message bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: receiveAllChanges
optional_parameters.description: By default, we only send a webhook notification on the first event of a message (i.e. when a message is received or sent). Subsequent changes of a specific message do not trigger a webhook (i.e. if a message changes folders). When this parameter is set to `true`, we will send all events related to a message.

optional_parameters.name: filterFolderRemoved
optional_parameters.description: Check for messages removed from a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label removed from a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

optional_parameters.name: bodyType
optional_parameters.description: Required to be set when “include_body” is set to get only body parts of a given MIME-type

optional_parameters.name: filterTo
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages received to a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

optional_parameters.name: filterFrom
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages received from a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

optional_parameters.name: filterEmailList
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages received from a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

optional_parameters.name: filterToDomains
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages sent to a given domain. Also accepts a comma delimited list of domains.

api_list.name: deleteAccount
api_list.description: If you need to delete an account, you can do so by using this endpoint. This will delete the account and all sources associated with it.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

api_list.name: deleteApplicationLevelWebhook
api_list.description: Delete a specific user level webhook.

required_parameters.name: webhookId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a user level webhook.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

api_list.name: deleteOauthProvider
api_list.description: Delete an oauth provider.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: providerConsumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key for this external OAuth provider

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

api_list.name: deleteSource
api_list.description: If you wish to only delete a certain source from the account, but not delete the account itself.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: label
required_parameters.description: The label property of the source instance. You can use word `first` as an alias for the first source of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

api_list.name: deleteUserLevelWebhook
api_list.description: Delete a specific user level webhook.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: webhookId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a user level webhook.

api_list.name: discoveringImapSettings
api_list.description: If you prefer to handle your own authentication and add accounts or sources manually, you may want to check for IMAP configuration settings to add users. The Discovery endpoint returns known IMAP configuration settings given an email address.

required_parameters.name: email
required_parameters.description: An email address you want to discover IMAP settings for.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: sourceType
required_parameters.description: The type of source you want to discover settings for.

api_list.name: downloadFilesContents
api_list.description: There are a couple ways you can download the file itself from the API.Get the file itself in the response;Get an AWS link you can use to download the file;

required_parameters.name: fileId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a file.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

optional_parameters.name: asLink
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true`, get an AWS link you can use to download the file.

api_list.name: getAccountDetails
api_list.description: Getting details at the account level will give you:Account creation date;List all sources linked to the account;Number of messages currently in the mailbox;

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

api_list.name: getAllApplicationWebhooks
api_list.description: List all application level webhooks.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

api_list.name: getAllConnectTokensForAccount
api_list.description: Use this call to list all connect tokens associated with an account (used or unused).

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

api_list.name: getAllConnectTokensForSource
api_list.description: Use this call to list all connect tokens associated with a source (used or unused).

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: label
required_parameters.description: The label property of the source instance.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

api_list.name: getAllContacts
api_list.description: There are several ways you can interact with a user’s contacts.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

optional_parameters.name: sortOrder
optional_parameters.description: The sort order of the returned results.

optional_parameters.name: activeAfter
optional_parameters.description: Only include contacts included in at least one email dated after a given time.

optional_parameters.name: search
optional_parameters.description: String identifying the name or the email address of the contact(s) you are looking for.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Start the list at this offset (zero-based).

optional_parameters.name: activeBefore
optional_parameters.description: Only include contacts included in at least one email dated before a given time.

optional_parameters.name: sortBy
optional_parameters.description: The field by which to sort the returned results.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum limit is 100. The default if no limit is provided is 25.

api_list.name: getAllFiles
api_list.description: The name of a source in Context.IO is called a “label”. The label will be included in the response when you get account or source details and looks something like `email::provider`.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

optional_parameters.name: from
optional_parameters.description: Email address of a contact messages have been received from.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Start the list at this offset (zero-based).

optional_parameters.name: emailOfContactBCC
optional_parameters.description: Email address of a contact BCC'ed on the messages.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: Email address of the contact for whom you want the latest files in which this email address was listed as a recipient.

optional_parameters.name: fileSizeMin
optional_parameters.description: Search for files based on their size (in bytes).

optional_parameters.name: indexedAfter
optional_parameters.description: Only include messages indexed after a given timestamp. This is not the same as the date of the email, it is the time Context.IO indexed this message.

optional_parameters.name: dateAfter
optional_parameters.description: Only include messages after a given timestamp. The value this filter is applied to is the Date: header of the message which refers to the time the message is sent from the origin.

optional_parameters.name: sortOrder
optional_parameters.description: The sort order of the returned results.

optional_parameters.name: fileName
optional_parameters.description: Search for files based on their name. You can filter names using typical shell wildcards such as *, ? and [] or regular expressions by enclosing the search expression in a leading / and trailing /. For example, *.pdf would give you all PDF files while /.jpe?g$/ would return all files whose name ends with .jpg or .jpeg

optional_parameters.name: dateBefore
optional_parameters.description: Only include messages before a given timestamp. The value this filter is applied to is the Date: header of the message which refers to the time the message is sent from the origin.

optional_parameters.name: source
optional_parameters.description: Filter messages by the account source label.

optional_parameters.name: indexedBefore
optional_parameters.description: Only include messages indexed before a given timestamp. This is not the same as the date of the email, it is the time Context.IO indexed this message.

optional_parameters.name: to
optional_parameters.description: Email address of a contact messages have been sent to.

optional_parameters.name: emailOfContactCC
optional_parameters.description: Email address of a contact CC'ed on the messages.

optional_parameters.name: fileSizeMax
optional_parameters.description: Search for files based on their size (in bytes).

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum limit is 100. The default if no limit is provided is 25.

api_list.name: getAllMessages
api_list.description: List all messages in the account (including all sources associated with the account). This call hits our cache of metadata for the account, so this call should be faster than hitting IMAP.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

optional_parameters.name: source
optional_parameters.description: Filter messages by the account source label.

optional_parameters.name: subject
optional_parameters.description: Get messages whose subject matches this search string. To use regular expressions instead of simple string matching, make sure the string starts and ends with /.

optional_parameters.name: indexedBefore
optional_parameters.description: Only include messages indexed before a given timestamp. This is not the same as the date of the email, it is the time Context.IO indexed this message.

optional_parameters.name: includeThreadSize
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` to include thread size in the result.

optional_parameters.name: bodyType
optional_parameters.description: Used when includeBody is set to get only body parts of a given MIME-type (for example text/html).

optional_parameters.name: includeHeaders
optional_parameters.description: Can be set to `false` (default), `true` or raw. If set to `true`, complete message headers, parsed into an array, are included in the results. If set to raw, the headers are also included but as a raw unparsed string. Since full original headers bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: emailOfContactBCC
optional_parameters.description: Email address of a contact BCC'ed on the messages.

optional_parameters.name: fileSizeMin
optional_parameters.description: Search for files based on their size (in bytes).

optional_parameters.name: sortOrder
optional_parameters.description: The sort order of the returned results.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Start the list at this offset (zero-based).

optional_parameters.name: dateBefore
optional_parameters.description: Only include messages before a given timestamp. The value this filter is applied to is the Date: header of the message which refers to the time the message is sent from the origin.

optional_parameters.name: from
optional_parameters.description: Email address of a contact messages have been received from.

optional_parameters.name: dateAfter
optional_parameters.description: Only include messages after a given timestamp. The value this filter is applied to is the Date: header of the message which refers to the time the message is sent from the origin.

optional_parameters.name: includeBody
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` to include message bodies in the result. Since message bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: includeSource
optional_parameters.description: Set to 1 to include message sources in the result. Since message sources must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: indexedAfter
optional_parameters.description: Only include messages indexed after a given timestamp. This is not the same as the date of the email, it is the time Context.IO indexed this message.

optional_parameters.name: includeFlags
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` to include thread size in the result.

optional_parameters.name: to
optional_parameters.description: Email address of a contact messages have been sent to.

optional_parameters.name: fileName
optional_parameters.description: Search for files based on their name. You can filter names using typical shell wildcards such as *, ? and [] or regular expressions by enclosing the search expression in a leading / and trailing /. For example, *.pdf would give you all PDF files while /.jpe?g$/ would return all files whose name ends with .jpg or .jpeg

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Filter messages by the folder (or Gmail label).See more in readme.

optional_parameters.name: emailOfContactCC
optional_parameters.description: Email address of a contact CC'ed on the messages.

optional_parameters.name: fileSizeMax
optional_parameters.description: Search for files based on their size (in bytes).

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum limit is 100. The default if no limit is provided is 25.

optional_parameters.name: emails
optional_parameters.description: Email address(es) or top level domain of the contact for whom you want the latest messages exchanged with. By “exchanged with contact X” we mean any email received from contact X, sent to contact X or sent by anyone to both contact X and the source owner. This accepts a single address or a comma separated list.

api_list.name: getAllOauthProviders
api_list.description: List all oauth providers linked to your Context.IO API key.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

api_list.name: getAllSourceFolders
api_list.description: List folders for a given source (email address).

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: sourceLabel
required_parameters.description: The label property of the source instance. You can use word `first` as an alias for the first source of an account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

optional_parameters.name: noCache
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` to fetch the folder list directly from the IMAP server. Since data must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: includeExtendedCounts
optional_parameters.description: Set to `include` to include extended counts in the result (for now, the only extended count supported is number of unseen messages). Since counts must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

api_list.name: getAllSources
api_list.description: If the account has more than once source, this endpoint will list all sources associated with the account. Optional parameters will allow you to filter by source status.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

optional_parameters.name: statusOk
optional_parameters.description: Set to `false` to get sources that are not working correctly. Set to `true` to get those that are.

optional_parameters.name: status
optional_parameters.description: Only return sources whose status is of a specific value.

api_list.name: getAllUserWebhooks
api_list.description: List all webhooks set on a specific user.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey

required_parameters.name: webhookId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a user level webhook.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

api_list.name: getConnectTokenDetails
api_list.description: Getting data about connect token will tell you:If the connect token was used;It not used, you will see when it will expire;If the connect token was used, you will see data about which source was added with the connect token;

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: token
required_parameters.description: The unique random token used to add a second source to an existing account.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

api_list.name: getContactDetails
api_list.description: Get information about a given contact such as when a message was last sent or last received, as well as how many messages have been sent to this contact, or received from this contact.

required_parameters.name: email

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: fileId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a file.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

api_list.name: getFilesSharedWithContact
api_list.description: List files shared with a specific contact(s).

required_parameters.name: email
required_parameters.description: Email address of a contact

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Start the list at this offset (zero-based).

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum limit is 100. The default if no limit is provided is 25.

api_list.name: getFolderMessages
api_list.description: Listing messages from a specific folder.

required_parameters.name: sourceLabel
required_parameters.description: The label property of the source instance. You can use word `first` as an alias for the first source of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: folder
required_parameters.description: The full folder path using / as the path hierarchy delimiter.

optional_parameters.name: includeHeaders
optional_parameters.description: Can be set to `false` (default), `true` or `raw`. If set to `true`, complete message headers, parsed into an array, are included in the results. If set to raw, the headers are also included but as a raw unparsed string. Since full original headers bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: includeThreadSize
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` to include thread size in the result.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum limit is 100. The default if no limit is provided is 25.

optional_parameters.name: bodyType
optional_parameters.description: Used when includeBody is set to get only body parts of a given MIME-type (for example text/html).

optional_parameters.name: flagSeen
optional_parameters.description: Message has been read. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

optional_parameters.name: includeFlags
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` to include thread size in the result.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Start the list at this offset (zero-based).

optional_parameters.name: includeBody
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` to include message bodies in the result. Since message bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

api_list.name: getListMessagesExchange
api_list.description: Get a list of email messages exchanged with one or more email addresses. This includes messages sent by a contact, received from a contact, or where both the contact and mailbox owner are included in the list of recipients.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum limit is 100. The default if no limit is provided is 25.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Start the list at this offset (zero-based).

api_list.name: getListThreadsIncludeContact

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum limit is 100. The default if no limit is provided is 25.

api_list.name: getMessage
api_list.description: Get an individual message based on a `messageId`. You can use either a `messageId` or `emailMessageId`

required_parameters.name: messageId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

optional_parameters.name: includeFlags
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` to include thread size in the result.

optional_parameters.name: includeBody
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` to include message bodies in the result. Since message bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: includeSource
optional_parameters.description: Set to 1 to include message sources in the result. Since message sources must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: bodyType
optional_parameters.description: Used when includeBody is set to get only body parts of a given MIME-type (for example text/html).

optional_parameters.name: includeHeaders
optional_parameters.description: Can be set to `false` (default), `true` or `raw`. If set to `true`, complete message headers, parsed into an array, are included in the results. If set to raw, the headers are also included but as a raw unparsed string. Since full original headers bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: includeThreadSize
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` to include thread size in the result.

api_list.name: getMessageBody
api_list.description: The name of a source in Context.IO is called a “label”. The label will be included in the response when you get account or source details and looks something like `email::provider`.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: messageId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

optional_parameters.name: type
optional_parameters.description: Many emails are sent with both rich text and plain text versions in the message body and by default, the response of this call will include both.

api_list.name: getMessageFlags
api_list.description: This call lists all flags currently applied to this message.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey

required_parameters.name: messageId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

api_list.name: getMessageFolders

required_parameters.name: messageId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

api_list.name: getMessageHeaders
api_list.description: This call returns only the headers for this message. We send a parsed response by default, but you can also choose to get the raw RFC 822 headers.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: messageId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

optional_parameters.name: raw
optional_parameters.description: By default, this returns messages headers parsed into an array. Set this parameter to `unparsed` to get raw unparsed headers.

api_list.name: getMessageRawSource
api_list.description: This endpoint returns the raw RFC 822 source message.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: messageId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

api_list.name: getMessageThread
api_list.description: This endpoint returns the the entire thread of messages a message is in that Context.IO has access to. Replies in the thread from accounts not in Context.Io would not appear here.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: messageId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

optional_parameters.name: bodyType
optional_parameters.description: Used when includeBody is set to get only body parts of a given MIME-type (for example text/html).

optional_parameters.name: sortOrder
optional_parameters.description: The sort order of the returned results.

optional_parameters.name: includeHeaders
optional_parameters.description: Can be set to `false` (default), `true` or `raw`. If set to `true`, complete message headers, parsed into an array, are included in the results. If set to raw, the headers are also included but as a raw unparsed string. Since full original headers bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Start the list at this offset (zero-based).

optional_parameters.name: includeBody
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` to include message bodies in the result. Since message bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: includeFlags
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` to include thread size in the result.

optional_parameters.name: includeSource
optional_parameters.description: Set to 1 to include message sources in the result. Since message sources must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum limit is 100. The default if no limit is provided is 25.

api_list.name: getOauthProviderDetails
api_list.description: Get information about an oauth provider.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: providerConsumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key for this external OAuth provider

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

api_list.name: getSourceDetail
api_list.description: The name of a source in Context.IO is called a “label”. The label will be included in the response when you get account or source details and looks something like `email::provider`.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: label
required_parameters.description: The label property of the source instance.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

api_list.name: getSourceFolder
api_list.description: Get information about a given folder such as number of messages, number of unseen messages, and other attributes.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: folder
required_parameters.description: The full folder path using / as the path hierarchy delimiter.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: sourceLabel
required_parameters.description: The label property of the source instance. You can use word first`` as an alias for the first source of an account.

optional_parameters.name: includeExtendedCounts
optional_parameters.description: Set to `include` to include extended counts in the result (for now, the only extended count supported is number of unseen messages). Since counts must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: delimiter
optional_parameters.description: If / isn’t fancy enough as a hierarchy delimiter when specifying the folder you want to obtain, you’re free to use what you want, just make sure you set this delim parameter to tell us what you’re using.

api_list.name: getUserWebhookDetail
api_list.description: Get information about a single user level webhook, such whether it is active and what filters are set on the webhook.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: webhookId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a user level webhook.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

api_list.name: moveMessage
api_list.description: This call allows you to move a message between folders, or also change the message’s flags all at once. If there are more than one source on the account, you can use this call to copy/move the message between these sources.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: folderToCopied
required_parameters.description: The folder within dst_source the message should be copied to.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: messageId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

optional_parameters.name: flagSeen
optional_parameters.description: Message has been read. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

optional_parameters.name: flagDeleted
optional_parameters.description: Message is `deleted` for later removal. An alternative way of deleting messages is to move it to the Trash folder. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

optional_parameters.name: sourceLabel
optional_parameters.description: Label of the source you want the message copied to. This field is required if you’re moving a message that already exists in one source of the account to another source of that account.If you only want to move the message to a different folder within the same source, folderToCopied is sufficient.

optional_parameters.name: flagAnswered
optional_parameters.description: Message has been answered. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

optional_parameters.name: flagDraft
optional_parameters.description: Message has not completed composition (marked as a draft). Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

api_list.name: updateApplicationLevelWebhook
api_list.description: Edit an existing webhook. Please note changes to an existing webhook are not appended but overwritten.To update the user webhook, you must specify one of the optional parameters.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: webhookId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a user level webhook.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

optional_parameters.name: failureNotifyUrl
optional_parameters.description: (DEPRECATED) A valid URL Context.IO calls if the WebHooks fails and will no longer be active. That may happen if, for example, the server becomes unreachable or if it closes an IDLE connection and we can’t re-establish it.

optional_parameters.name: callbackUrl
optional_parameters.description: A valid URL Context.IO calls when a matching message is found. The callback URL is called with an HTTP POST with message information in request body

optional_parameters.name: active
optional_parameters.description: By default, webhooks are set to active when first created. Set to 'false' to temporarily stop receiving callbacks for this webhook. Set to `true` again to resume.

optional_parameters.name: filterThread
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages in a given thread. Value can be a gmail_thread_id or the email_message_id of an existing message currently in the thread.

optional_parameters.name: filterFolderAdded
optional_parameters.description: Check for messages filed in a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label applied to a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

optional_parameters.name: filterSubject
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages with a subject matching a given string or regular expression.

optional_parameters.name: includeBody
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` to include message bodies in the result. Since message bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: receiveDrafts
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true`, you will receive messages that are flagged as `Drafts` in Gmail

optional_parameters.name: includeHeader
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` or raw to include message headers in the result.

optional_parameters.name: filterFolderRemoved
optional_parameters.description: Check for messages removed from a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label removed from a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

optional_parameters.name: filterFileName
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages where a file whose name matches the given string is attached.

optional_parameters.name: receiveAllChanges
optional_parameters.description: By default, we only send a webhook notification on the first event of a message (i.e. when a message is received or sent). Subsequent changes of a specific message do not trigger a webhook (i.e. if a message changes folders). When this parameter is set to `true`, we will send all events related to a message.

optional_parameters.name: filterFolderRemoved
optional_parameters.description: Check for messages removed from a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label removed from a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

optional_parameters.name: receiveHistorical
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true`, we will perform a backscan of an account when a new account is added and send messages from new to old to your callback URL.

optional_parameters.name: bodyType
optional_parameters.description: Required to be set when “include_body” is set to get only body parts of a given MIME-type

optional_parameters.name: filterTo
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages received to a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

optional_parameters.name: filterFrom
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages received from a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

optional_parameters.name: filterEmailList
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages received from a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

optional_parameters.name: filterToDomains
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages sent to a given domain. Also accepts a comma delimited list of domains.

api_list.name: updateMessage
api_list.description: This call allows you to copy or move a message between folders, or also change the message’s flags all at once. If there are more than one source on the account, you can use this call to copy/move the message between these sources.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: folderToCopied
required_parameters.description: The folder within dst_source the message should be copied to.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: messageId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

optional_parameters.name: flagAnswered
optional_parameters.description: Message has been answered. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

optional_parameters.name: move
optional_parameters.description: By default, this calls copies the original message in the destination. Set this parameter to `true` to move instead of copy.

optional_parameters.name: flagDraft
optional_parameters.description: Message has not completed composition (marked as a draft). Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

optional_parameters.name: sourceLabel
optional_parameters.description: Label of the source you want the message copied to. This field is required if you’re moving a message that already exists in one source of the account to another source of that account.If you only want to move the message to a different folder within the same source, folderToCopied is sufficient.

optional_parameters.name: flagDeleted
optional_parameters.description: Message is `deleted` for later removal. An alternative way of deleting messages is to move it to the Trash folder. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

optional_parameters.name: flagSeen
optional_parameters.description: Message has been read. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

api_list.name: updateMessageFlags
api_list.description: This call will allow you to set or unset flags for a specific message.To update the Messagge Flags, you must specify one of the parameters - seen,answered,flagged,deleted,draft.

required_parameters.name: messageId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

optional_parameters.name: answered
optional_parameters.description: Message has been answered. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

optional_parameters.name: deleted
optional_parameters.description: Message is `deleted` for later removal. An alternative way of deleting messages is to move it to the Trash folder. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

optional_parameters.name: seen
optional_parameters.description: Message has been read. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

optional_parameters.name: draft
optional_parameters.description: Message has not completed composition (marked as a draft). Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

optional_parameters.name: flagged
optional_parameters.description: Message is “flagged” for urgent/special attention. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

api_list.name: updateUserLevelWebhook
api_list.description: Webhooks set at the user level are applicable only to the user on which the webhook is set. User level webhooks should be used for cases when you will be monitoring things that are very specific to each individual user.To update the user webhook, you must specify one of the optional parameters.

required_parameters.name: accountId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of an account.

required_parameters.name: consumerKey
required_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.

required_parameters.name: webhookId
required_parameters.description: Unique id of a user level webhook.

required_parameters.name: consumerSecret
required_parameters.description: The consumer secret from your account.

optional_parameters.name: active
optional_parameters.description: By default, webhooks are set to active when first created. Set to 'false' to temporarily stop receiving callbacks for this webhook. Set to `true` again to resume.

optional_parameters.name: callbackUrl
optional_parameters.description: A valid URL Context.IO calls when a matching message is found. The callback URL is called with an HTTP POST with message information in request body

optional_parameters.name: failureNotifyUrl
optional_parameters.description: (DEPRECATED) A valid URL Context.IO calls if the WebHooks fails and will no longer be active. That may happen if, for example, the server becomes unreachable or if it closes an IDLE connection and we can’t re-establish it.

optional_parameters.name: filterThread
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages in a given thread. Value can be a gmail_thread_id or the email_message_id of an existing message currently in the thread.

optional_parameters.name: filterFolderAdded
optional_parameters.description: Check for messages filed in a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label applied to a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

optional_parameters.name: filterSubject
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages with a subject matching a given string or regular expression.

optional_parameters.name: filterFolderRemoved
optional_parameters.description: Check for messages removed from a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label removed from a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

optional_parameters.name: receiveAllChanges
optional_parameters.description: By default, we only send a webhook notification on the first event of a message (i.e. when a message is received or sent). Subsequent changes of a specific message do not trigger a webhook (i.e. if a message changes folders). When this parameter is set to `true`, we will send all events related to a message.

optional_parameters.name: filterFileName
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages where a file whose name matches the given string is attached.

optional_parameters.name: filterFolderRemoved
optional_parameters.description: Check for messages removed from a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label removed from a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

optional_parameters.name: bodyType
optional_parameters.description: Required to be set when “include_body” is set to get only body parts of a given MIME-type

optional_parameters.name: receiveDrafts
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true`, you will receive messages that are flagged as `Drafts` in Gmail

optional_parameters.name: includeBody
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` to include message bodies in the result. Since message bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: includeHeader
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` or raw to include message headers in the result.

optional_parameters.name: filterTo
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages received to a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

optional_parameters.name: filterFrom
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages received from a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

optional_parameters.name: filterEmailList
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages received from a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

optional_parameters.name: filterToDomains
optional_parameters.description: Check for new messages sent to a given domain. Also accepts a comma delimited list of domains.

api_list.name: webhookEvent
api_list.description: The Todoist Webhooks API allows applications to receive real-time notification (in the form of HTTP POST payload) on the subscribed user events. Notice that once you have a webhook setup, you will start receiving webhook events from all your app users immediately.

optional_parameters.name: consumerKey
optional_parameters.description: The consumer key from your account.
